title: Sri Lanka president promises PM, cabinet in week
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s President Gotabaya Rajapaksa said he appoint a Prime Minister who commanded the confidence of the parliament and the people and a cabinet of ministers within a week.
During this week I will work to appoint a cabinet and PM and who commands a parliamentary majority and can have the confidence of the people,” President Rajapaksa said in a televised address.

I will change the constitution to give more powers to parliament giving effect to the items contained in the the 19th amendment. I will give the opportunity for the new govt and PM to start a new program to take the country forward.
After stability is restored he said he will talk to all parites and give an opportunity to do what is needed for that.
President Rajapaksa called for calm and said he condemned the attack on peaceful protestors.
He said the subsequent violent actions had led to deaths of several persons and damage to property.
